node.title: Murdered woman Suzanne Poll's husband breaks down in court as he recounts night he found her body
node.description: The husband of a woman murdered in an Adelaide stationery shop nearly three decades ago has broken down in court recalling the moment he discovered his wife's bloodied body in the back storage area of the shop where she worked. The following story contains content some readers may find distressing.
node.content:
["The husband of a woman murdered in an Adelaide stationery shop nearly three\u00a0decades ago has broken down in court recalling the moment he discovered his wife's bloodied body in the back storage area of the shop where she worked.", "The following story contains content some readers may find distressing.", "Suzanne Poll, 36, was killed with a knife in a \"ferocious\" manner while she worked alone during late night shopping in April 1993.", "Matthew Donald Tilley, 48, is on trial in the Supreme Court after pleading not guilty to her murder.", "Ms Poll's husband, Darryl, told the trial he found his murdered wife at the Salisbury shop after she had failed to return home at the usual time that night.", "He broke down as he told the jury he had never told anyone what he had seen that night.", "\"It's going to be very hard for me to tell you,\" he told the court.", "\"I don't talk about it and I don't talk to anyone else about it.\"", "", "
Police look for evidence near the Salisbury shop where Suzanne Poll was murdered in 1993.(ABC News)
", "He said he tried to ring the shop's landline several times but there was no answer, so he drove to the Parabanks Shopping Centre, where he found his wife's car still in the car park.", "\"I could see lights on in the shop and walked over to the shop,\" he told the jury.", "\"I walked over to the door, opened up the door and sung out her name.", "\"I didn't get any response so I walked over.\"", "He said he got as far as the shop counter when he noticed the back storage door was ajar and he could see Ms\u00a0Poll's legs on the floor and a lot of blood.", "", "
Ms Poll's husband, Darryl, gave evidence in the trial.(ABC News)
", "\"There was blood everywhere, she was lying on the floor on her back,\" he said.", "\"I tried to see if she had any pulse and that's when I noticed all her hands were cut.", "Mr Poll told the jury he noticed his wife's handbag next to her, which was open and appeared to have been gone through.", "He said she had at least $200 in cash in her handbag that she had withdrawn earlier that day for mechanical repairs.", "
Victim spoke about what she would do in a robbery
", "Mr Poll cried when prosecutor Carmen Matteo asked if he and his wife had a happy marriage.", "\"Yes,\" he replied.", "The court heard the couple married in 1984 and had two children together.", "", "
Suzanne Poll with her children, Melissa and Adam.(Supplied)
", "Mr Poll told the jury he and Ms Poll\u00a0had spoken a few times about what she would do if the shop was ever robbed.", "\"We spoke about it a couple of times because there were a lot of servos being ripped off at the time,\" he said.", "The trial has previously heard blood samples taken from Ms Poll's handbag and three spots around the store entrance were years later linked to Mr Tilley's brother and later Mr Tilley when they obtained a DNA sample from a discarded takeaway coffee cup.", "Ms Matteo previously said the DNA showed Mr Tilley was \"billions\" of times more likely to be the matching person than any other human.", "Mr Tilley's lawyer, Jane Abbey, has previously told the jury to keep an open mind as there was dispute\u00a0around the identity of Ms Poll's killer."]
